page.title: 13WORKING HOUSEWIFE
page.content: Pauline Lawrance is a thirty seven year old playgroup supervisor. She has lived in Portchester for nineteen years. She has no major problems in life but believes the main problems faced by the nation are unemployment, inflation and nuclear war. When asked her solution to these problems she said the first two were too complex and it would be unrealistic to expect Britain to disarm unilaterally. She says a local issue at the moment is the proposal to sell land south of the community centre. It should be left as open space. Her main hope for the future is for her two children to gain employment. According to her, Britain has lost its credibility as a major force during her lifetime.
